## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ppchazardrecognizer970">PPCHazardRecognizer970</a> - This class defines a finite state automata that models the dispatch logic on the PowerPC 970 (aka G5) processor.

This promotes good dispatch group formation and implements noop insertion to avoid structural hazards that cause significant performance penalties (e.g. setting the CTR register then branching through it within a dispatch group), or storing then loading from the same address within a dispatch group.

Definition at line 55 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-h">PPCHazardRecognizers.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### AdvanceCycle() {#a3a753e31908cc070fa8a7f138bb81978}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void PPCHazardRecognizer970::AdvanceCycle ()"
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
AdvanceCycle - This callback is invoked whenever the next top-down instruction to be scheduled cannot issue in the current cycle, either because of latency or resource conflicts.

This should increment the internal state of the hazard recognizer so that previously &quot;Hazard&quot; instructions will now not be hazards.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-h/#l00080">80</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-h">PPCHazardRecognizers.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-cpp/#l00425">425</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-cpp">PPCHazardRecognizers.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getHazardType() {#a930f5688f2bff088096f72a68000c94e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ScheduleHazardRecognizer::HazardType PPCHazardRecognizer970::getHazardType (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42; SU, int Stalls)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
getHazardType - We return hazard for any non-branch instruction that would terminate the dispatch group.

We turn NoopHazard for any instructions that wouldn&#39;t terminate the dispatch group that would cause a pipeline flush.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-h/#l00078">78</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-h">PPCHazardRecognizers.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-cpp/#l00325">325</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-cpp">PPCHazardRecognizers.cpp</a>.

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void PPCHazardRecognizer970::Reset ()"
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Reset - This callback is invoked when a new block of instructions is about to be schedule.

The hazard state should be set to an initialized state.
